title: NPM : Init
mainDescription: This command gives an interactive way to create our package.json file.
If you don't want to change any values , just press Enter OR give the input(s) as you like.
The below example will make it clear.
postDescription: we can see how npm interactively communicates and lets us know what is possible as input and what is not.
If you want a default package.json then : <-- npm init --yes --> would do the magic.

title: NPM : Install
mainDescription: This command scans our package.json and installs all the dependencies under the node_modules directory.

title: NPM : Start
mainDescription: Usually the start command is what we usually give in the package.json.
It is used to get our project running.
postDescription: In the above snapshot we can see the test script. Similarly we will have the action for start as well.

title: NPM : Help
mainDescription: Help is pretty cool in NPM.
To Know more about a particular command : <-- npm <command_name> -h -->.
One other way to do this is by : <-- npm help <command_name> --> , This will open up the official help file of the command.

title: NPM : Search Help
mainDescription: If you want to search across the help pages in npm then : <-- npm help-search <search_string_here> -->.

title: NPM : Set Defaults
mainDescription: We can set the default values across npm which will be used during npm init.
For exampleL author_name,author_email,license can be set to default values.
postDescription: Post this if we do npm init on any project we will have the default values set in package.json.

title: NPM : Get Defaults
mainDescription: To get the value of a specific default setting: <-- npm get <default_name> -->.

title: NPM : Remove Defaults
mainDescription: To remove the default values set above used: <-- npm config delete <default_name> -->.
postDescription: These default setting's can be found under: .npmrc
